conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The light blue liquid flows out from A and hits the purple baffle.
The light blue liquid is redirected by the purple baffle and flows down into the orange container (D).
The yellow liquid flows out from B and hits the purple baffle.
The yellow liquid combines with the flow from A and goes into the orange container (D).
The blue liquid flows out from C and hits the grey baffle first.
The blue liquid is redirected by the grey baffle toward the green container (E).
After passing through the baffles, the liquids from A and B go into container D, while the liquid from C goes into container E.
